required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessing the Usability and Clinical Utility of the Congo Red Dot Test: A Survey
clinical_study.official_title: Assessing the Usability and Clinical Utility of the Congo Red Dot Test: A Survey

brief_summary.textblock: To determine if pregnant women can understand the instructions, carry out the test, and interpret the test results regarding the need for follow-up or treatment women will be recruited to complete a test instruction and comprehension assessment and a usability assessment.

detailed_description.textblock: To determine if pregnant women can understand the instructions, carry out the test, and interpret the test results regarding the need for follow-up or treatment women will be recruited to complete a test instruction and comprehension assessment and a usability assessment. Study participants will be a convenience sample of women seeking prenatal services. Participants will first be asked to review the instructions for the Congo Red Dot Test and complete a short written questionnaire that assesses their comprehension of the test instructions. Participants will then be asked to perform the test using their own urine sample and to interpret the results obtained by answering a second written questionnaire. After the woman performs the test, a healthcare provider will use the urine sample to perform a second test.

primary_outcome.description: proportion of women who demonstrated various levels of understanding of the instructions for the CRD Test

secondary_outcome.description: the proportion of women able to correctly use the CRD test

arm_group.description: Pregnant women seeking prenatal services at Hospital Materno-Infantil Inguarán will take the Congo Red Dot Test individually by following the Congo Red Dot Test instructions

intervention.description: The Congo Red Dot test is a simple test has been developed to detect unfolded or misfolded proteins in urine.

study_pop.textblock: Women attending Hospital Materno-Infantil Inguarán for prenatal care will be eligible for the study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant
- Eligible to consent for research
- Able to read Spanish well enough to read the test instructions
- Able to give informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
